results.title: Matilda country
results.brief_description: Winton is an isolated town in central Queensland, whose history is associated with the writing of the song “Waltzing Matilda” by Banjo Patterson in 1895. Several people of the district including the postmaster, a woman on a station, a station owner and a truck driver, talk about life at Winton. The work of the mail contractor and post office are shown. Devised by Rob Gerrand for Australia Post.

results.title: Mathsphere 2
results.brief_description: Mathsphere aims to bring the real world into the classroom. By placing mathematics in a real context, for example, the examination of environmental issues, the objective is to see mathematics as a human activity. Each episode is in two parts with a corresponding mathematical process or activity. Exercises and data are provided in the accompanying booklet. Topics include manipulating data, percentages and ratios, spreadsheets, geometry, algebra, trigonometry, statistical methodologies and fractions. The programs are pitched so that they can be applied to different levels of study.

results.title: Mathsphere
results.brief_description: These videos present maths problems that may be encountered in the real world. Mathematical techniques and their applications are shown hand in hand giving relevance to a variety of topics. Areas covered include collecting and presenting data, estimating, measuring and accuracy, scale and enlargement, probability, plans and elevations. The video includes a special ‘Mathsphere activity pack’.

results.title: Maths with everything (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: A Graphic Film, John Arnold and John Krish
results.brief_description: Demonstrates British child centred methods of teaching mathematics to children aged five to seven. The film’s point is that maths includes all activities if teachers know where to look for opportunities to teach it, using experiences that interest and totally involve the children. Writer John Krish for the Nuffield Mathematics Teaching Project. Explores thematic approach to mathematics. Begins with an in-service program for infant teachers. They construct a mural and then proceed to discover maths in it. A class teacher in a school situation then adopts the same approach using the theme ‘buses’.

results.title: Maths for the 21st century
results.brief_description: This video says all the right things about maths and is entirely consistent with Frameworks. It has a Queensland focus (Teachers are a little passive compared to Victoria and the workshop style of Calvin Irons is certainly different). However, it should be a useful stimulus film for schools conducting their own self-help stimulus programs. The first sessions could be run over 5 weeks, hence its impact could develop as teachers progressively engage the ideas. No other credits available.

results.title: Maths at home
results.brief_description: Illustrates a number of ways in which parents can maximise mathematically orientated activities with their children using everyday home activities. Includes sorting and counting in many forms, Monopoly, map reading and cooking.

results.title: Maths alive (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Educationa Foundation for Visual Aids and John Howard
results.brief_description: Shows primary school children learning mathematics from their own discoveries. The teachers have planned the work after careful observations of the children using materials in their own environment. Experiments undertaken are part of a sequence and show progression, but the children are free to follow particular interests as they arise. Music by Jocelyn Crompton.

results.title: Mathica's mathshop
results.brief_description: Young children learn to recognise, solve and enjoy mathematical problems by putting mathematics in a meaningful context. Viewers are engaged in story-related problems involving numbers, measurement and geometry. Ten episodes of 15 minutes duration dealing with a number of concepts. Based on familiar or traditonal tales, children are given challenges to solve, such as how many different ways can the seven dwarfs go to a picnic if they have two cars. Suitable for Lower Primary students.

results.title: Mathew Brady: photographer of an era
results.brief_description: Presents the history of the American Civil War through the lens of photographer Mathew Brady. This photographic record includes a portion of Lincoln’s second inaugural address. Music by Paul Keuter, featuring folk singer Eleanor Stone.
